repnme.cdata!:
Macedonia - Children and Youth Development
            Project (LIL)

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Macedonia - Children and
            Youth Development Project (LIL) were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: 1) the successful delivery of life skills training
            and other relevant modules could be further expanded if
            delivered also within the formal school system; 2)
            non-formal education programs are most-effective (and
            marketable for employment purposes) where official
            certification is provided for these programs; 3) there is a
            need to differentiate between programs for adolescents and
            youth; and 4) demand-driven approaches should be combined
            with national level planning and policy.

repnme.cdata!:
Macedonia - Children and Youth Development
            Project (LIL) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Children and Youth Development
            Project in Macedonia, will significantly increase social
            cohesion, through the social integration of youth at risk
            from different socio-cultural backgrounds. To this end,
            community-based approaches will be tested to support
            adolescents, and youth at risk, and, institutional capacity
            will be strengthened, to contribute to the implementation of
            a Children and Youth Strategy. The two main components will:
            1) continue to test methods, and experimentation, through
            existing Babylon youth centers. The inter-ethnic youth
            activities cover sports, computer, and information
            technology (IT) training. And, in addition to regular
            scholastic activities, English language, social skills and
            creativity, journalism, and seminars and workshops will be
            supported. Innovative approaches will be explored for youth
            social integration, through the use of outreach, and
            targeted pilot programs, by establishing eight new centers,
            proposed by nongovernmental organizations in a demand-driven
            selection process, designed to elicit new ideas in
            disadvantaged areas. Expansion of the Youth and Sport's
            innovative drug abuse prevention program will be supported
            for all secondary schools in the country, and to the Babylon
            centers; and, 2) consolidate the youth component, by
            supporting the participatory development of the Children,
            and Youth Strategy, to promote ownership, and sustainability
            of the program, and, by establishing monitoring mechanisms
            to facilitate institutional capacity building.

repnme.cdata!:
Macedonia - Children and Youth Development
            Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the environmental management
            plan format for the Child and Youth Development Project in
            Macedonia. It reviews the adverse environmental impacts
            resulting from implementation of the project, and proposes
            mitigation measures as follows. Construction, and
            rehabilitation of community facilities, such as schools, or
            public buildings, will require installation of quality
            heating, be it central, or through individual electric
            heaters, an environmental concern which will be minimized
            through monitoring, and improvement of electric
            installation, conducting fire prevention measures, and, by
            replacing existing wiring as needed. Rehabilitation of
            sanitary facilities, will follow strict guidelines on
            environmental sanitation, namely appropriate connections to
            clean water, and sewage disposal systems. The lack of
            community awareness remains an issue of concern,
            particularly when facing the need to create opportunities
            for community action, therefore, an environmental awareness
            program will address the need for clean-up actions,
            vegetative propagation, with a specific commitment from
            children, and youth alike, to oversee plants, and tree
            growing. Institutional arrangements should supervise
            mitigation activities, monitoring, and training.
